chapter.title: Installing eBox using the Debian packages
chapter.para: eBox is available as Debian packages which can be easily installed using apt-get.

First of all you should have a clean Debian Sarge installation with a 2.6 kernel. Then you just need to add the following line to your /etc/apt/sources.list:
deb http://projects.warp.es/ebox/debian/ ./
After running apt-get update you should be able to get a list of available ebox packages by running:
apt-cache -n search ebox

Once you have performed the previous steps you just need to install the desired packages using:
apt-get install ebox-<module>
This command should install every other required package, so you shouldn't bother with module dependencies.

For example, to get a eBox like the one installed in the previous chapter with firewall and proxy capabilities you should just run:
apt-get install ebox-firewall ebox-squid
This will download the required packages, install them and configure everything correctly. After the process has finished you can access the eBox administrative interface in .
